intro: Pyrola atrovirens, commonly known as the blackleaf wintergreen, is a perennial herb native to the northeastern United States and eastern Canada. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest floors, often in acidic soils, and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are dark green and leathery, while its flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in early spring. Pyrola atrovirens is an important component of understory plant communities in coniferous and mixed hardwood forests.
